titleStmt.title: The appellation of Iohn Knoxe from the cruell and most iniust sentence pronounced against him by the false bishoppes and clergie of Scotland, with his supplication and exhortation to the nobilitie, estates, and co[m]munaltie of the same realme.
titleStmt.author: Knox, John, ca. 1514-1572.
Gilby, Anthony, ca. 1510-1585. An admonition to England and Scotland.
Kethe, William, d. 1608?

notesStmt.note: Includes, with caption title: "An admonition to England and Scotland to call them to repentance, written by Antoni Gilby", "Iohn Knoxe to the reader", by Knox, and "Psalme of Dauid XCIII, turned into metre by W. Kethe", each with caption title.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
